poem:
The Long Black Ascendant  

In the sanctuaries of steam  
where machines hum like ancient bees,  
a new ritual of the bean unfolds.  
Once, the Americano reigned,  
its diluted strength appeasing,  
now cast aside for shadows deeper,  
the complex black,  
untainted,  
claims dominion.  
In the cup cradled,  
darkness whispers,  
seeking soul's deeper thirst.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The long black: will this soon be the UK’s favourite coffee order? In these fancier coffee spots, everyone’s dependable, unfussy go-to is being eclipsed by a newer". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
